DOC.detailed_description: The PNB trial investigator-initiated , prospective , randomize control trial test superiority pudendal nerve block 0.33 % ropivacaine intravenous tramadol 1.5mg/kg CRBD prevention . A total 94 patient undergoing elective prostate surgery lithotomy position urinary catheterization ( 16 G Fr Foley catheter ) anesthetic induction general anesthesia enrol West China Hospital Sichuan University . Patients divide randomly two group : The PNB group : patient give bilateral pudendal nerve block 30ml 0.33 % ropivacaine ( 15ml side ) completion surgery extubation . The TRAM group : patient give tramadol 1.5mg/kg completion surgery extubation . All patient evaluate research nurse blind group assignment outcomes 0 , 1 , 2 , 4 , 6h patient ' arrival PACU , extraction urinary catheter . The primary outcome incidence postoperative CRBD . The secondary outcome include severity postoperative CRBD , postoperative tramadol requirement number patient require postoperative tramadol , numeric rating scale ( NRS ) postoperative pain , postoperative sufentanil requirement number patient require postoperative sufentanil , postoperative side effect , acceptance indwell urinary catheter extraction catheter . All primary secondary endpoint analyze intent-to-treat basis . Analyses perform use SPSS 18.0 software . The Student-t test use analyze demographic data two group . The incidence CRBD side effect group analyze Chi-square test , whereas severity CRBD ( mild , moderate , severe ) analyze Fisher 's exact test . NRS scale analyze Mann-Whitney test . Postoperative tramadol sufentanil requirement analyze Z test , number patient require tramadol CRBD rescue treatment sufentanil postoperative pain analyze Fisher 's exact test . A P value < 0.05 consider significant .
